Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Calibration \Cal`ibra"*tion\, n. The process of estimating the caliber a tube, as of a thermometer tube, in order to graduate it to a scale of degrees; also, more generally, the determination of the true value of the spaces in any graduated instrument. [1913 Webster]

calibration n : the act of checking or adjusting (by comparison with a standard) the accuracy of a measuring instrument; "the thermometer needed calibration" [syn: {standardization}, {standardisation}]
